question: The name of Billy Arjan Singh is most closely associated with which among the following National Parks of India?
explanation: Billy Arjan Singh was born in Gorakhpur in 1917 and had died in January 2010. He was a hunter who once after killing a young leopard, became a conservationist and campaigned for creating the Dudhwa National Park. He was awarded the World Wildlife Fundâ€™s Gold Medal in 1976. He received the Padma Shri in 1995 and again in 1996 a WWF Gold Medal. In 1997, he also received Order of the Golden Ark.Billy Arjan Singh established the Tiger Haven Society in 1992 and also released a work `Tiger Haven`.
